Class UserAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • UserAccount

  • public class UserAccount
extends java.lang.Object
    The UserAccount class is used to create objects of accoounts that store information about that user.
    Author:
    Group E

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserAccount(java.lang.String u, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> bo, java.util.ArrayList<java.time.LocalDate> dd, boolean m)
      Constructor that takes information for the attributes: username, booksOut, dueDates, manager, and sets bookLimit to 3.
      UserAccount(java.lang.String u, boolean m)
      Constructor that takes information for the attributes: username manager, and sets bookLimit to 3.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserAccount

        public UserAccount(java.lang.String u,
                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> bo,
                   java.util.ArrayList<java.time.LocalDate> dd,
                   boolean m)
        Constructor that takes information for the attributes: username, booksOut, dueDates, manager, and sets bookLimit to 3.
        Parameters:
        u - user name of the user
        bo - ArrayList of the users books out
        dd - ArrayList of the due dates for each book the user has out
        m - boolean that informs if the user is a manager or not

      • UserAccount

        public UserAccount(java.lang.String u,
                   boolean m)
        Constructor that takes information for the attributes: username manager, and sets bookLimit to 3. Used when the user has no books out.
        Parameters:
        u - user name of the user
        m - boolean that informs if the user is a manager or not
